title: Starwood Capital Rakes in $10 Billion for Distressed Real-Estate Deals
sub_head: Firm has already deployed $3.5 billion from the fund, CEO Barry Sternlicht said
body:
Starwood Capital Group has hauled in more than $10 billion for its latest pool to invest in distressed real estate such as hotels, office buildings and residential housing.
The Miami Beach, Fla.-based firm said its Starwood Distressed Opportunity Fund XII and related entities collected nearly a third more than a predecessor vehicle, which wrapped up with $7.55 billion in 2018. Fund XII can be invested in the U.S. and Europe, according to Barry Sternlicht, Starwoodâ€™s chairman and chief executive.
